text: I'm interested, who on here tries to find an edge using fundamentals vs trying to find their edge with price action alone? I'm only looking at price action at the moment.

text: Like <@U4H19D1D2> if you set aside TPD I use 100% market signals. I don't do the single update 'snapshot' thing though. You certainly can do it like that but if you're able to develop signals that look deeper over time then it makes sense to me to integrate them.

text: Im not sure really as I never watch the race as such (only the prices), What I can say is that I once went to Lingfield on a corporate day and the jockey that was hosting us, took us down to the last fence to watch the action. I has my VPS on my phone and watched that the prices had already hit 1.15 ish as two horses jumped the fence (in mid air) almost in parallel. That was a lightbulb moment for me as I couldnt fathom how anyone could make a judgement call on that.

text: my point about forward projects and valuing, kinda comes from games and reinforcement learning, for example a classic example in chess you use MCTS, you play out moves using a mini max algorithm and value board positions into the future. It kinda feel similar to me in a sense, that you may want to define a value function at T+bet delay. Im clueless though when it comes to IP, just something that came into my head , probably has no parallels though by the sounds

text: mmm, so created a new bot based on our discussions the other day, which "offers" at what I see as "value" bets wrt BSP, no hedging, £2 bets, and have run it over the last 2 days. Not sure I can handle the variance, placed 60 bets, and currently -£60 down ! although it's not faired that bad against BSP which a theoretical hedge at BSP producing a profit of +£1 . So the scary thing is how volatile the variance can be, or i've just been unlucky.. breakeven theoretical, -£60 in reality ! I'm actually thinking I should maybe hedge "some" of the bet at BSP to keep me sane!? Out of the 27 Lay bets, 8 Lost! Of the 33 Back bets only 4 won :-(

I'm actually thinking I should maybe hedge "some" of the bet at BSP to keep me sane!? Out of the 27 Lay bets, 8 Lost! Of the 33 Back bets only 4 won :-(

text: Backtest your strategy over a long enough period and you'll get an idea of what downswings you can expect. If you're unhappy with the risk profile, you can always work on it. For example employing the kelly criterion.

elements.text: Backtest your strategy over a long enough period and you'll get an idea of what downswings you can expect. If you're unhappy with the risk profile, you can always work on it. For example employing the kelly criterion.

text: Any time I get a positive EV, I'm happy as that's an indicator hat there might be something there. But it's just a starting point. The next step is to look for other signals with which it could be combined to push the EV up and bring the variance down. But you need way more data that a handful of days of experience. I typically backtest several months worth of data (usually circa 10,000 active bets) to obtain data for training and development and then run the candidate strategy against as much again to validate that it holds up on previously unseen data. Only then does it get launched onto the exchange with small stakes to see how it performs in the real world.

elements.text: Any time I get a positive EV, I'm happy as that's an indicator hat there might be something there. But it's just a starting point. The next step is to look for other signals with which it could be combined to push the EV up and bring the variance down. But you need way more data that a handful of days of experience. I typically backtest several months worth of data (usually circa 10,000 active bets) to obtain data for training and development and then run the candidate strategy against as much again to validate that it holds up on previously unseen data. Only then does it get launched onto the exchange with small stakes to see how it performs in the real world.
